alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 11:15PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTY... At 1114 PM EST, a snow squall was located over Emsworth, or near Franklin Park, moving east at 35 mph. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Franklin Park, Shaler Township, Plum, West Mifflin, North Side Pittsburgh, and Baldwin. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 36 and 58. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 75. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 61 and 84. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.
